Collections of acute diseases, the fourth part It contains all that the learn'd and experienc'd Dr. Sydenham has written of agues, of a pleurisie, of a bastard peripneumonia, of a quinsey, and of the cholera morbus. And all that the famous Dr. Willis has written of a peripneumonia. Collections of acute diseases. Part 4. Pechey, John, 1655-1716. Sydenham, Thomas, 1624-1689. Willis, Thomas, 1621-1675.
[2], 94, [4] p.
printed by J.R. and are to by [sic] sold by Henry Bonwicke at the Red-Lyon in St. Pauls Church-Yard, London : 1691.
With errata and advertisement on the verso of the title page. Final leaves = contents. By John Pechey. Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
=======
